Squizzy::
She nodded to LadyHawk. She turned her back to her and worked on the 
computer, gathering the info.  She wasn't really happy with this bot. 
Something about her felt fake. But she couldn't put her finger on it. 
Her mongoose insticts told her that there was a snake near by. She 
glanced back at LadyHawk and smiled. Then turned back to the computer 
console. She watched as the printer printed up the sheets and she 
folded them up and placed them on the counter for later on.  

Her sweet, innocent, friendly nature would give her the advantage.  
She only played at being this little helpless bot that was just so 
helpful.  She was still new enough to this group that she couldn't do 
anything.  She wondered seince she was no fighter, if she could work 
her way up through the ranks and see just how far she could go.  She 
wasn't sure if she wanted to stay with these bots yet or not.  Sh 
also wasn't sure if they were the strongest group around. IF they 
were the best, she would stay with them. If not, she would learn all 
she could and then turn over the info to the strongest group. Her 
survival insticts were on full swing.  For her, insticts were a more 
involved thought proccess, not just a gut feeling.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk curled up in a corner with her wings folded around her. 
Squizzy
> might not be entirely incompetent after all, "If there are any 
problems wake
> me, with any luck you'll turn out to be a usefull lackey yet." she 
closed
> two of her eyes, keeping the third one active and on Squizzy.
